SENT.plain: In 28 patients with benign intracranial hypertension, CT showed an abnormality in 36% of cases
The abnormalities included small ventricles, empty sella, enlarged cisterna magna, and dilated optic nerve sheaths
The only reversible changes were small-sized ventricles and basal cisterns, which returned to normal size after CSF pressure returned to normal
One patient with visual loss and one with normal acuity had enlarged optic nerve sheaths
